statements: SELECT * FROM Employee;
SELECT full_name, department FROM Employee WHERE department = 'IT';
SELECT employee_id, email FROM Employee WHERE full_name LIKE '%Smith%';
SELECT * FROM Employee ORDER BY full_name ASC;
SELECT department, COUNT(*) AS num_employees FROM Employee GROUP BY department;
SELECT * FROM Employee WHERE department = 'Marketing';
SELECT full_name, email FROM Employee WHERE employee_id = '12345678';
SELECT full_name, phone_number FROM Employee WHERE department = 'Technology' ORDER BY full_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM Employee WHERE phone_number LIKE '%1234%' ORDER BY full_name DESC;
SELECT employee_id, full_name, email FROM Employee WHERE email IS NOT NULL AND department IS NOT NULL ORDER BY employee_id;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, department FROM employees WHERE department = 'Sales';
SELECT department, COUNT(*) AS num_employees FROM employees GROUP BY department;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE employee_id = 1001;
SELECT name, contact_details FROM employees WHERE department = 'HR' AND employee_id > 1002;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department='IT' ORDER BY name ASC, employee_id DESC;
SELECT name, department FROM employees WHERE employee_id BETWEEN 100 AND 200;
SELECT employee_id, name, department, contact_details FROM employees WHERE department='HR' OR department='Finance' ORDER BY department, name DESC;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE name LIKE '%John%' AND contact_details LIKE '%@example.com';
SELECT e.employee_id, e.name, d.name as department_name FROM employees e LEFT JOIN departments d ON e.department = d.department_id ORDER BY e.employee_id ASC, department_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM Employees;
SELECT name, department FROM Employees WHERE id = 1;
SELECT name, contact_number FROM Employees WHERE department = 'HR';
SELECT id, name FROM Departments ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT employee_id, email FROM Contacts WHERE email LIKE '%@example.com%';
SELECT * FROM Employees WHERE department = 'IT'
SELECT name, department FROM Employees WHERE id > 100 ORDER BY name DESC
SELECT e.name, d.location FROM Employees e JOIN Departments d ON e.department = d.name WHERE e.id = 50
SELECT c.email, e.name FROM Contacts c JOIN Employees e ON c.employee_id = e.id WHERE e.department = 'HR' ORDER BY c.email
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_employees, MAX(id) AS max_employee_id FROM Employees
SELECT * FROM Employees;
SELECT name, department FROM Employees ORDER BY department DESC;
SELECT contact_info FROM Contacts WHERE contact_type='email';
SELECT name, salary_amount FROM Employees INNER JOIN Salaries ON Employees.employee_id = Salaries.employee_id;
SELECT DISTINCT department_name FROM Departments;
SELECT * FROM Employees WHERE department = 'IT'
SELECT name, department FROM Employees ORDER BY department ASC
SELECT MAX(salary_amount) FROM Salaries
SELECT name, contact_info FROM Employees INNER JOIN Contacts ON Employees.employee_id = Contacts.employee_id
SELECT name, salary_amount FROM Employees INNER JOIN Salaries ON Employees.employee_id = Salaries.employee_id WHERE salary_amount > 50000
SELECT id, name, department FROM employees WHERE department = 'HR';
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE name LIKE 'J%';
SELECT id, department FROM employees WHERE id BETWEEN 100 AND 200;
SELECT name, contact_details FROM employees WHERE department = 'IT' ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT id, department FROM employees WHERE name IN ('Alice', 'Bob', 'Charlie') ORDER BY id ASC;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, department FROM employees WHERE department = 'Sales';
SELECT e.name, d.name AS department FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department = d.id;
SELECT e.name, ec.email, er.role FROM employees e JOIN employee_contacts ec ON e.id = ec.employee_id JOIN employee_roles er ON e.id = er.employee_id;
SELECT e.name AS employee_name, d.name AS department_name, ec.email, ec.phone_number FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department = d.id JOIN employee_contacts ec ON e.id = ec.employee_id;
